node.title: James sought a CT scan to explain his constant headaches. What they found had 'a bunch of people panicking'
node.alt: A young man sits in a cafe.
node.description: James Enaver says the first signs that he was ill were the persistent headaches that started three years ago. Now, a fundraising effort by friends and family has led to Tasmania's first tumour biobank.
node.content:
["James Enaver says the first signs that a tumour was growing inside his brain were\u00a0the persistent headaches that started\u00a0three years ago.", "A particularly bad one led him to the emergency department but that was dismissed as dehydration.", "A year \u2014 and many more painful headaches \u2014 later, a doctor suggested a CT scan.", "\"And then on the day I went for the CAT scan I saw a bunch of people panicking behind a glass window,\" he said.", "\"And then they got me an ambulance and drove me to hospital and that was it.\"", "The discovery of the brain tumour quickly led to surgery.", "\"The first treatment was the debulking operation \u2014\u00a0that's where they went into the head, got the tumour, and cut it off into a more manageable size,\" he said.", "\"And then the second part was radiation and then the part after that was chemotherapy.", "\"And now, apparently, it's stable.\"", "", "
James Enaver can enjoy go-karting with his father now that his brain cancer is stable.(ABC News: Selina Ross)
", "Mr Enaver's tumour was found soon after one of his mother's colleagues was also diagnosed with brain cancer.", "The two cases inspired a group of friends and family to raise money for brain cancer research, through the Royal Hobart Hospital Research Foundation.", "
Friends and family wanted to 'make a difference'
", "Jo Kelder, who worked with James's mum, said the group originally considered something small.", "", "
Jo Kelder and a group of friends organised a fundraising event.(ABC News: Selina Ross)
", "\"We started out thinking 'in my house, couple of friends' and then a couple of weeks later it was 'why don't we go all out and raise a heap of money for something that is going to make a difference?'\" she said.", "\"We started branching out and hassling anybody we knew who had money or friends or things that they could donate and people were very, very generous.\"", "They held a fundraising cocktail event in December 2020 and hit their target of raising $25,000 \u2014\u00a0enough to fund a significant research project.", "", "
ABC Hobart presenter Ryk Goddard and medical oncologist Rosemary Harrup at the fundraiser.(Supplied: Jo Kelder)
", "\"We want to do something that was going to make a difference, not just for them but for anyone who has brain cancer in Tasmania,\" Ms Kelder said.", "
Tumour tissue snap frozen
", "The Royal Hobart Hospital Research Foundation selected a proposal to create Tasmania's first brain tumour biobank at the Menzies Institute for Medical Research.", "Once operational, patients will be able to donate tissue samples from their tumours, to be\u00a0snap frozen and stored for medical research.", "Australian Institute of Health and Welfare statistics showed an estimated 1,896 cases of brain cancer would be diagnosed nationally in 2021.", "An estimated 1,528 people would die from the disease this year.", "", "
The Royal Hobart Hospital Research Foundation's\u00a0Heather Francis says a biobank will help researchers pick up trends.(ABC News: Selina Ross)
", "The institute's chief executive, Heather Francis, said a biobank was a very valuable resource.", "\"Developing a biobank for future analysis around brain cancer that's specific to Tasmania but can also relate to other biobanks nationally and globally is really vital,\" Ms Francis said.", "\"There's so much that we don't know about brain cancer but delivering a really solid registry through that biobank will enable us to start to pick up trends, to start to identify areas for further research.\"", "
Hope that biobank will lead to new treatments
", "", "
Medical oncologist Rosemary Harrup says the brain cancer biobank is going through the process of obtaining regulatory approval.(ABC News: Selina Ross)
", "Medical oncologist Rosemary Harrup said the brain cancer biobank was going through the process of obtaining regulatory approval.", "\"The biobank provides samples for young clinicians, scientists and researchers to study tumours in the laboratory, in the hopes that we meet that unmet need of new and more effective treatments going forward,\" she said.", "\"We can look at the proteins, the genes, a new technique called methylation, and various other procedures to try to understand tumours in their entirety.\"", "Dr Harrup said it would also help assess the impact of treatments.", "\"With serial specimens for patients who need reoperation at some point in time, we may actually be able to study the effects of cancer therapies \u2014 chemotherapy, radiotherapy and some of the new targeted therapies \u2014 and try to understand why sometimes these therapies are not successful,\" she said.", "\"Patients have always wanted to be able to donate their samples from surgery and now we have that facility available.\""]
